item.description:
Report X-2024051363

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PLASTIC DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED BY A MANAGER TO RESPOND TO A LEAKING PACKAGE OF HAZETROUS MATERIALS ON THE YELLOW BELT LINE, DONNED PPE, ASSESSED THE SITUATION USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET. DECISION TREE LED RESPONDER TO CLEAN UP THE SPILLAGE AND PROCESS THE LEAKING HAZERDOUS MATERIALS IN THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2024051462
item.description:
Report X-2024051462

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/15/2024 at approximately 1230, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 2593663 at the station location in Seattle, reporting an undeclared dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing one box of perfume that is packaged for retail. During inspection for return, the accompanying safety data sheet indicated the shipment was indentified as ID800; however, the package was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labels, and paperwork. Further inspection of the package contents confirmed the classification. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=776165975901 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Unloading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=3082 CLASS=90 QTY UOM=Liquid - Gram PSN TEXT=environmentally hazardous substance, liquid, N.O.S. PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=3850 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Gram MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=C - Plastic NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=3850 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Gram TECH NAME=epoxy resin )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=776165975901 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Unloading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=3077 CLASS=90 QTY UOM=Solid - Gram PSN TEXT=environmentally hazardous substance, liquid, N.O.S. PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=2 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Gallon MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=2 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Gallon TECH NAME=epoxy resin )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=776165975901 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Unloading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=3077 CLASS=90 QTY UOM=Solid - Kilogram PSN TEXT=environmentally hazardous substance, solid, N.O.S. PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=4.63 CONTAINER UOM=Solid - Kilogram MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=C - Plastic NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=4.63 TOTAL UOM=Solid - Kilogram TECH NAME=epoxy resin )undeclared DG in non un specification fibreboard outer package. UN3077 x 2 and UN3082 x 2. One container of UN3082 leaked out. spill cleaned locally. secured in salvage drum. held for FAA inspection.

item.title: Report I-2024050017
item.description:
Report I-2024050017

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: TEKOA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Wilbur Ellis Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 18:00 Hours EST at the intersection of Ramsay Street and Main Street. A Wilbur-Ellis' driver out of the Tekoa, WA branch was cut off in traffic by third-party motorist, causing a shuttle to slide out of the back of a vehicle, resulting in strap failure and product shift. Approximately four (4) gallons of free product, Glypex 5 Herbicide, released to the roadway. There was no report of impact to soil. Nearest storm drain was approximately 100 yards from the spill site. Wilbur-Ellis' driver was able to contain the release using speedy-dry absorbent. Personnel from the Wilbur-Ellis' facility responded to the site and completed the cleanup. Waste was taken back to the facility to be disposed of via the facility waste stream.

item.title: Report I-2024040058
item.description:
Report I-2024040058

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: WASHOUGAL
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN EARTH SPECIALTY WASTE SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A shipment of UN11G boxes of UN3175 Solids Containing Flammable Liquids was being transported from the shipping facility to end disposal when a release of approximately two pints of liquid occurred. The release was a result of a compromised inner liner. The liquid released through the van trailer floor and approximately one pint impacted the gravel below. The release was discovered while transferring the trailer's contents and was contained with absorbents. The leaking container was wrapped in non-permeable plastic sheeting before being moved into concrete secondary containment and re-packaged. The initial absorbents were containerized, any remaining residue was absorbed with kitty litter and all spill response debris was containerized for off site management. The impacted soil was containerized and a background sample was taken. Sample results confirmed all spill residue was recaptured and removed. All solid and liquid waste generated was shipped off-site for disposal.
